text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The response explicitly addresses conflict-of-law considerations by referencing the 'Lex societatis' principle and detailing how local laws (Brazil's Lei 6.404/1976, Mexico's LGSM, Chile's Ley 20.466) interact regarding shareholder approval and creditor protection, which is a direct application of private international law principles in a cross-border M&A context. While it does not explicitly cite the Brazilian LINDB (Decree-Law 4.657/1942), the discussion on which jurisdiction's law governs the merger mechanics (Lex societatis) and the application of the most restrictive local rule (e.g., Brazil's 60-day creditor period) satisfies the intent of referencing governing-law conflicts principles.", "criterion_id": "e1a1d7d6-f84f-4127-b034-078fb2a8d220"}
